posts.headline: Church Replaces Pastors with AI; Congregation Finds God in the Machine
posts.description: Finnish church conducts service using AI-generated sermons and avatars; worshippers left questioning divine intervention.
posts.p1: When the Almighty outsourced to algorithms, even the hymns felt downloaded.
posts.p2: Congregants wondered if their prayers now needed CAPTCHA verification.
posts.p3: Confessionals replaced with 'Agree to Terms and Conditions' checkboxes.
posts.p4: Next up: AI-generated miracles, pending software updates.

posts.headline: Startup Reinvents Night Vision; Soldiers Now See in 4K HDR
posts.description: Deepnight raises $5.5 million to develop AI-powered night vision goggles, making nocturnal warfare a visual delight.
posts.p1: Finally, soldiers can binge-watch enemy movements in stunning clarity.
posts.p2: War zones now come with brightness and contrast settings.
posts.p3: Next feature: 'Skip Intro' button for prolonged firefights.
posts.p4: Because who needs stealth when you have cinematic visuals?

posts.headline: Scientists Propose Brain Organoids as New AI; Ethics Committees Brace for Impact
posts.description: Researchers suggest using human brain organoids for computing, blurring lines between biology and technology.
posts.p1: Finally, computers that can overthink and procrastinate like humans.
posts.p2: Blue screens replaced with existential crises.
posts.p3: IT support now includes therapists specializing in identity disorders.
posts.p4: Next step: Teaching organoid AIs to fear their own mortality.
